However, the company faces rising client incentives and expenses, which may weigh slightly on margins . Omega Flex dominates the U.S. flexible metal hose market via its TracPipe and CounterStrike lines . But margin pressure from steep tariffs, BOGS weakness, wholesale softness and geographic concentration pose risks . McDonald's benefiting from menu innovation, value offerings and global expansion strategies . Blackstone's net inflows, diversified products and revenue mix will likely drive revenue mix . Micron is a compelling long-term AI investment because it is a leader in high-bandwidth memory chips that are critical for AI workloads . MU trades at a huge discount to Tech, though its stock has outpaced the sector for the last 20 years . MU works directly with AI chip powerhouse Nvidia and its closest rival, AMD .  Micron announced on June 12 that it is expanding its U.S. investments to $200 billion, including $150 billion for memory chip manufacturing and $50 billion for R&D . Micron is a vertically integrated semiconductor company that designs, manufactures, and tests most of its chips in-house .  Micron's memory segment has been one of the most boom-and-bust parts of the historically cyclical semiconductor industry . Micron’s revenue has fluctuated alongside consumer spending and production cycles across smartphones, PCs, laptops, vehicles, and more . The rise of data centers and artificial intelligence could see Micron become a bit more decoupled from those business cycles .  Micron's HBM chip shipments are on track to ramp significantly in the second half of 2025, positioning Micron as a key beneficiary of surging AI-related infrastructure spending . Micron’s adjusted earnings are expected to skyrocket by 433% in FY25 and another 56% next year, from $1.30 in FY24 .  MU stock has climbed roughly 1,100% in the past 20 years to crush the Zacks Tech sector’s 770%, and it's almost doubled Tech in the last 15 years . MU is still trading well below its all-time highs, even though the stock has soared 90% since April and 45% in 2025 .  Micron trades at a 50% discount to Tech and near its 10-year median at 12.5X forward earnings . Factoring in its stellar earnings growth outlook via its PEG ratio, MU trades at 0.2 vs. Tech’s 1.7 . Micron also pays dividends, and its balance sheet is robust .

The Senate Finance Committee approved an amendment in its section of the 2026 budget bill that increases the semiconductor investment tax credit from 25% to 30% . The act would benefit chipmakers like Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing(TSM)and Micron(MU), as it would boost the value of their subsidies .  Nvidia stock closed at $144.12 on June 17, just shy of its all-time high of $149.41 posted in January . On May 28, Nvidia reported strong fiscal first-quarter results . However, company forecasts revenue of $45 billion in the July quarter, missing analysts’ projections by nearly $1 billion .  Tensions between China and the U.S. remain the Damocles’ sword hanging over Nvidia . China remains a key market for Nvidia, accounting for 13% of its sales in the past financial year . If the world's two largest economies fail to reach a trade deal, it could hit Nvidia’s bottom line .  Barclays analyst Tom O'Malley raised the firm's price target on Nvidia to $200 from $170 . Given Nvidia's current stock price, the target implies an upside of 39% . The firm raised its forecast for the Compute segment to $37 billion from $35.6 billion .  Analysts revamp forecast for Nvidia-backed AI stock Nvidia stock could surge after surprising Taiwan Semi news . Wall Street's average price target on Nvidia stock is $172.36, with a high forecast of $210.00 .

Texas Instruments recently announced a substantial $60 billion investment to build seven semiconductor fabs in the U.S. Over the last quarter, the company's stock price increased by 9% . This aligns closely with broader market trends, as both Texas Instruments and market indices have posted similar gains .  Over a five-year period, Texas Instruments' total shareholder return, including dividends, was 79.59%. The current share price movement, reflecting a 9% increase over the last quarter, suggests positive growth . Such investments are likely to enhance production capabilities and fortify the company's market position .  The share price remains at a discount to the consensus analyst price target of US$180.76 . This indicates the potential for further price adjustments as the company's plans materialize and market conditions evolve .  Companies discussed in this article includeNasdaqGS:TXN . The company’s strategically-timed dividends and planned investment in PsiQuantum may have further added momentum to the stock's upward trajectory . Be aware that NVIDIA is showing 1 weakness in our investment analysis .  NVIDIA's total shareholder return has been very large at 1430.11%, reflecting substantial long-term growth . Dell Technologies is poised to enhance NVIDIA's AI-powered security offerings . This partnership aligns with NVIDIA's expanding presence in advanced technology sectors .  NVIDIA's recent 22.63% share price increase highlights positive sentiment and aligns with a strategic shift in business focus . Simply Wall St has no position in any stocks mentioned . Companies discussed in this article include NasdaqGS:NVDA and Nasdaq GS: NVDA .

The graphics processing unit (GPU) king's market capitalization peaked early this year at nearly $3.7 trillion . A months-long slide that bottomed out in April shaved about $1.4 trillion off its value . Nvidia stock has rebounded over the last month and has almost fully recovered from that .  The chart below illustrates the fluctuations in Nvidia's market cap throughout 2025 . The volatility in the stock in January and February was triggered by the emergence onto the scene of Chinese AI start-up DeepSeek . I'll explain why investor enthusiasm for the chip designer is on the rise and detail why I think the stock is poised for an epic breakout during 2025's second half .  Nvidia sank to its 2025 low in the wake of President Donald Trump's announcement of new tariffs on China . Investors came to recognize the existence of DeepSeek might not represent a major threat to Nvidia's business after all .  Nvidia's management recently notified investors that the company will be excluding China from its financial guidance for the time being . Earlier this year, executives fromOracle, OpenAI, andSoftBank met at the White House to announce a large-scale infrastructure initiative called the Stargate Project . The members of the joint venture intend to make a collective investment of $500 billion over four years .  For most of its history, Nvidia has been known as a hardware business . But some investors may not realize that the company has been quietly diversifying its ecosystem . Nvidia has developed a software platform called CUDA that allows developers to program its GPUs for the specific uses they require .  Nvidia has been trading the title of world's most valuable company back and forth withMicrosoft over the past month . Current analyst sentiment surrounding Nvidia stock suggests that shares could be headed for a breakout . Nvidia has swiftly become a full-stack provider of AI services .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisor's total average return is995% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to173% for the S&P 500 . Infrastructure investment and Nvidia's efforts to expand beyond chip design are the core reasons I think the company will continue rising in value .  Microsoft lost more than $1 Trillion in market cap earlier this year . The company is one of the 10 most valuable tech companies in the world .

Nvidia's stock price growth has slowed in 2025, but it continues to beat the market . The data center opportunity is expected to increase by double digits over the next few years . Nvidia stock was a winner even before generative AI took off when ChatGPT launched at the end of 2022 .  Nvidia's revenue increased 69% year over year in the fiscal 2026 first quarter . Data center segment revenue outpaced it, increasing 73% . The data center opportunity will keep growing along with AI, according to Fortune Business Insights .  Nvidia was $243 billion in 2024, and it's expected to increase at a compound annual growth rate of 11.7% through 2032 . This is just the beginning for AI, and Nvidia is well-positioned to tap into that high growth . The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team just identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now .  Nvidia is one of the 10 most profitable tech companies in the U.S. market . The company's stock has more than 1.8% of the market value of $1.2 billion .

Bernstein analysts maintain their bullish stance on Nvidia (NVDA), describing the opportunity as “enormous” and arguing that the AI revolution is still in its early stages . According to Bernstein, Nvidia is beginning a new product cycle with its groundbreaking Blackwell GPUs, which are experiencing unprecedented demand . The investment firm has a target price of $185 for NVDA stock, above the current price near $145 .  The chip maker’s technological leadership has enabled it to control over 90% of the GPU market . Nvidia is at the forefront of addressing the global labor shortage crisis with 50 million unfilled positions across the manufacturing and logistics sectors .  Nvidia’s valuation has reset to decade-long lows relative to projected earnings . The tech stock trades a 33.6x forward earnings, below its 5-year average of 49.2x . The global AI industry is expected to grow at a 42% compound annual rate over the next decade .  The average target price for Nvidia stock is $174, indicating an upside potential of over 20% . Analysts covering NVDA stock, 37 recommend “Strong Buy’s” and one recommends ‘Strong Sell’

Texas Instruments will invest more than $60 billion to expand semiconductor manufacturing in the United States . The investment will go towards seven semiconductor fabrication plants across Texas and Utah . It's part of the White House's push to keep the U.S ahead of China in the technology industry .  The announcement marks the latest major planned investment in the United States by an American company . Earlier this month, General Motors said it would invest $4 billion to increase US production . Apple said in February that it wouldinvest $500 billionto expand its US facilities .  Trump Mobile plans to launch a new smartphone in September that it claims will be “proudly designed and built” in the United States . Experts say manufacturing products like iPhonesdomestically would be a daunting challenge even if the U.S. had the necessary labor skills and components to produce them .  Intelligence Action Summit in Paris in February . “And our administration plans to keep it that way.” President Obama said in a statement that the U.S. will continue to engage in the intelligence community .

Dell (DELL) has been delivering impressive financial results . However, its stock remains surprisingly cheap . In its first quarter of fiscal 2026, Dell reported $23.4 billion in revenue, up 5% year-over-year . Its earnings per share (EPS) rose 17% to $1.55 in Q1, growing more than three times faster than revenue .  Dell is well-positioned to capitalize on growing investments in investments in AI infrastructure across various industries . Despite its strong performance, Dell stock is still trading at a forward price-earnings (P/E) ratio of 13.3x . Dell’s leadership forecasts a 15% increase in adjusted EPS for fiscal year 2026 .  Analysts currently have an average price target of $136.53 on Dell, suggesting 18% upside from current levels . Dell is experiencing surging demand for its AI-optimized server infrastructure, with $12.1 billion in orders booked in Q1 . Dell’s sales pipeline continues to expand across various enterprise sectors .  In storage, Dell continues to deliver strong performance . Q1 revenue grew 6%, marking the third straight quarter of profit and margin improvement . Traditional servers are also seeing a strong refresh cycle, with customers upgrading from older infrastructure to newer 16G and 17G servers .  Dell’s robust financial performance is driven by surging demand for AI-optimized infrastructure and consistent innovation across its product portfolio . Wall Street projects up to 34% upside and Dell continues to expand its presence in high-growth markets such as AI, storage, and enterprise infrastructure . Intel (INTC) is reportedly considering laying off between 15% and 20% of its foundry workers . The layoffs come after a brutal 2024 when the chip company eliminated 15,000 positions in its biggest-ever layoff . Intel's foundry business has failed to take off significantly despite burning billions of dollars . In this article, we'll discuss Intel's outlook in light of the cost cuts and turnaround efforts .  Intel continues to lose market share and is majorly losing out to Nvidia in the artificial intelligence chip market . New CEO Lip-Bu Tan has spoken about building a “new Intel” and stressed that there are no “quick fixes” to the company’s woes .  Intel’s mean target price is $22.42, which is 7.8% higher than the June 17 closing price . Of the 38 analysts covering Intel, 32 rate it a “Hold. ratings.” The stock is rated as a ‘Strong Buy’ by only one analyst .  Intel remains a turnaround play and could see a rerating if Tan can steer the long-awaited turnaround . Credit rating agencies have also taken note of its weak financial condition, and last year, Moody’s and S&P Global cut its credit rating .  The layoffs should help Intel cut down its costs and help uplift its margins . However, Intel needs to return to top-line growth sooner rather than later . Intel’s foundry business could help revive growth as hyperscalers are developing their custom chips and need partners with foundries .  Mohit Oberoi had a position in INTC, NVDA and NVDA at the time of publication . He says the companies need to focus on solid execution and strategic actions to drive shareholder value .

TerraPower is leading the advanced nuclear industry to market with its advanced nuclear reactor paired with a gigawatt-scale energy storage system . This raise is a testament to the company’s fundraising prowess; with participation from investors including NVentures, the venture capital arm of NVIDIA . The company began non-nuclear construction activities on the site of the ﬁrst plant .  "We are proud to have NVIDIA join our visionary group of investors," says CEO Chris Levesque . "As AI continues to transform industries, nuclear energy is going to become a more vital energy source to help power these capabilities," says NVentures .  TerraPower will continue to be a privately held company . Further terms of the fundraise were not disclosed . Federal support for deploying new plants was outlined last month in President Trump's executive orders .  1Natrium is a TerraPower and GE Hitachi technology . Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the10 best growth stocks to buy according to billionaires . The demand for its GPUs not only boosted the growth of AI-driven applications but also led to tremendous growth for the company . In fiscal year 2021, the Gaming segment accounted for approximately 50% of total revenue . Over the next four years, the Data Center business surpassed it, accounting for around 89% of revenue .  The consensus 1-year median price target still indicates over 20% upside . Oppenheimer analyst Rick Schafer reiterated a Buy rating on Nvidia with an unchanged price target of $175 . DBS analyst Fang Boon Foo revised the price target to $160 from $175. He cited healthy demand, solid margins, and a strong capital spending cycle across major tech firms as key drivers for Nvidia’s long-term performance .  The company’s GPUs are used in gaming, high-performance computing, AI training, and inference and serve as the backbone of data center infrastructure worldwide . While we acknowledge potential of NVDA as an investment, we believe certain AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk .

SAIR is the largest-ever detailed dataset of protein-ligand pairs with annotated experimental potency data . SAIR provides an unprecedented resource for researchers to advance AI models in drug discovery . SandboxAQ generated approximately 5.2 million synthetic 3D molecular structures .  SAIR uniquely integrates physics-based modeling with key LQM capabilities . SandboxAQ demonstrates its unique expertise in quantitative AI for drug discovery and the unparalleled capabilities of its proprietary LQMs .  The SAIR dataset offers researchers a comprehensive, high-quality resource to train advanced AI models that can accurately predict protein-ligand binding affinities . SandboxAQ's quantitative AI technology is already delivering superior outcomes through strategic partnerships with leading institutions and companies .  Researchers can access the SAIR dataset today on Google Cloud Platform or athttps://www.sandboxaq.com/sair . SandboxAQ's Large Quantitative Models consistently achieve superior hit rates .  SandboxAQ unveils a novel open-dataset of protein ligand structures . The company is partnering with T. Rowe Price Associates, Inc.,Alger, IQT, US Innovative Technology Fund, S32, Paladin Capital, BNP Paribas, Eric Schmidt, Breyer Capital, Ray Dalio, Marc Benioff, Thomas Tull, Yann LeCun .

The first vault will have top-of-the-range NVIDIA GPUs, which are currently used for "AI training and inference" The firms are projecting to have a yield, in USDC, that might go over 30% per year based on active enterprise GPU rental agreements .  Compute Labs is backed by Protocol Labs, OKX Ventures, CMS Holdings and Amber Group . The firm operates with a flat 10% fee structure across tokenization, asset management and performance yield .

Nebius Group N.V. (NASDAQ:NBIS) is one of the10 stocks that Jim Cramer and analysts are watching . DA Davidson raised its price target on the stock from $50 to $55 and maintained a Buy rating .  Certain AI stocks offer greater upside potential and carry less downside risk . NBIS stands to benefit significantly from Trump-era tariffs and the onshoring trend .

NVIDIA is at the center of AI computing, with its products widely used across data centers, gaming and autonomous vehicles . Arm Holdings is gaining importance with its AI-optimized CPU architectures, which are increasingly used in cloud and edge applications .  NVIDIA expects to lose another $8 billion in H20 sales during the second quarter . New U.S. rules stopped NVIDIA from selling its H20 chips to China, leading to lost sales of $2.5 billion in the first quarter . Despite the projected revenue loss from the Chinese market, the company is still on track for major growth .  Arm Holdings is positioned to benefit from the growing use of AI and the Internet of Things (IoT) Its energy-efficient chips are used in smart devices, autonomous systems and cloud infrastructure . Apple, Qualcomm and Samsung continue to rely on Arm’s architecture .  NVIDIA shares have risen 6.2% over the past year, while Arm Holdings has declined 16.9% . The Zacks Consensus Estimate projects NVIDIA’s earnings per share (EPS) to rise 42.1% in fiscal 2026 . NVIDIA trades at a more reasonable level .  NVIDIA carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), making it a clear winner over Arm Holdings . Arm's growth story is solid, but concerns about tariffs, China exposure and a high valuation make NVIDIA the stronger choice for investors looking for more balanced risk and return in AI . More than$60 billion investment includes seven U.S. semiconductor fabs across three manufacturing mega-sites inTexasand Utah . Investment includes investment of up to$40 billion dollars for four fabs: SM1 and SM2 – already underway – and two additional fabs, SM3 and SM4 . This is the largest investment in foundational semiconductor manufacturing in US history, building on TI's almost 100-year legacy .  Texas Instruments is expanding its U.S. manufacturing capacity to supply the growing need for semiconductors that will advance critical innovations from vehicles to smartphones . Combined, TI's new manufacturing mega-sites inTexasandUtahwill support more than 60,000 jobs . Apple, Ford, Medtronic, NVIDIA and SpaceX rely on TI's technology and manufacturing expertise .  TI is the largest semiconductor manufacturer in the U.S. Today, TI is producing analog and embedded processing chips that are critical for smartphones, vehicles, data centers, satellites and nearly every other electronic device . TI is building on its legacy of technology leadership to help its customers pioneer the next wave of technological breakthroughs .  Ford and TI are working to strengthen American manufacturing . Ford's automotive expertise with TI's semiconductor technology will help drive innovation and secure a robust, domestic supply chain for the future of mobility . "At Medtronic, our life-saving medical technologies rely on semiconductors to deliver precision, performance, and innovation at scale"  NVIDIA and TI share the goal to revitalize U.S. manufacturing by building more of the infrastructure for AI factories . SpaceX is increasingly leveraging TI's high-speed process technology to connect its Starlink satellite internet service with TI's latest 300mm SiGe technology .  TI is a driving force behind the return and expansion of semiconductor manufacturing in the U.S. The company's more than$60 billioninvestment includes building and ramping seven, large-scale, connected fabs . Backed by the strength of TI, SpaceX is manufacturing tens of thousands of Starlink kits a day .  Texas Instruments will manufacture hundreds of millions of U.S.-made chips daily that will ignite a bold new chapter in American innovation . SM1, TI's first new fab inSherman, Texas, will begin initial production this year . RFAB2, the world's first 300mm analog fab, continues to ramp to full production .  Texas Instruments is a global semiconductor company that designs, manufactures, and sells analog and embedded processing chips . At our core, we have a passion to create a better world by making electronics more affordable through semiconductors .

Each stock provides a distinct angle on the AI revolution, offering early-stage exposure as the technology moves into broader adoption .  In Q1 2025, revenue jumped 25% year over year to $762 million . As AI workloads scale across industries, real-time infrastructure visibility becomes non-negotiable . Palantir Technologies has grown from a secretive defense contractor into a leading force in AI-powered analytics . Broadcom is seeing huge growth in its AI semiconductor division . Broadcom isn't top of mind for many investors because it isn't laser-focused on AI . It has products sprawling from mainframe software to cybersecurity to virtual desktops . I could easily see it rising to a $2 trillion company within three years .  Broadcom's AI offerings are split into two categories: connectivity switches and custom AI accelerators, which it calls XPUs . Data centers need devices to stitch together the multi-piece answer, and they will become more important as we transition into the next phase of AI .  Broadcom's custom AI accelerators are an alternative to GPUs, as they can process multiple calculations in parallel . The difference between an XPU and a GPU is that XPUs are designed for a specific workload and don't have the flexibility of a GPU . The AI hyperscalers have a love-hate relationship with Nvidia, as Nvidia makes top-notch products but charges an incredibly high premium .  In fiscal year 2024, Broadcom's total revenue was $51.6 billion . Of that, only $12.2 billion was AI-related revenue . Broadcom expects its AI semiconductor revenue to reach $60 billion to $90 billion by FY 2027 .  Broadcom's trailing-12-month revenue total is $57 billion . With revenue likely more than doubling from now until 2027, I'm fairly confident that the stock will at least double . That will be enough to vault Broadcom into the $2 trillion valuation level, making the stock a successful investment .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is791% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to174% for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $886,880!

AEON was developed in partnership with Nvidia's AI supercomputers . The robot was revealed at the Hexagon LIVE Global conference . Future applications will include manipulation, asset inspection, reality capture, and operator support .  AEON is equipped with Nvidia Jetson Orin onboard computers, enabling it to navigate and perform tasks in real-time . Hexagon plans to pilot AEON in various settings, including factories and warehouses, where it will scan components and large assembly lines .  Nvidia robotics and edge AI vice president Deepu Talla said: “Hexagon’s new AEON humanoid embodies the integration of the . three-computer robotics platform and is making a significant leap forward in addressing industry-critical challenges”  You must obtain professional or specialist advice before taking, or refraining from, any action on the basis of the content of this article . as to its accuracy or completeness .

Shares of Nvidia fell below $100 earlier this year due to trade concerns . Now, however, the market is at around all-time highs, and so is Nvidia's stock . The company's cutting-edge artificial intelligence chips are crucial for many tech businesses deploying next-gen technologies .  Nvidia's market cap may be around $3.5 trillion, but it trades at a modest forward price-to-earnings (P/E) multiple of 33 (based on analyst estimates) The average stock on theS&P 500 trades at 22.9 times its future earnings .  Nvidia still faces considerable uncertainty about trade restrictions involving one of its key markets, China . The problem with Nvidia's valuation is it may look cheap, but only if its growth rate remains high . Any hint of a pullback could send the stock back to less than $100 .  Nvidia's sales were up by an incredible 69% in its most recent quarter, which ended on April 27 . If that growth rate were to fall below 30%, investors would be nearly as bullish about the stock as they are now . But based on Nvidia's high valuation, a best-case scenario still looks to be priced in .  You may still be better off simply buying Nvidia stock sooner rather than later . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $660,821!  Nvidia shares have outperformance compared to174% for the S&P 500 . Nvidia has outperformed its competitors in recent years . The Motley Fool has no idea what the future of Nvidia's stock market is .

Both companies possess promising growth prospects related to artificial intelligence . Super Micro Computer has bounced back this year after a tumultuous year when its auditor resigned . SoundHound AI more than doubled its sales last quarter and has a modest market cap of less than $4 billion .  SoundHound AI rose to prominence last year after chipmakerNvidiadisclosed a position in the voice AI company . Supermicro provides valuable AI infrastructure that businesses need to scale their operations . It got into some trouble last year regarding its finances, including its financial auditor resigning . The company trades at just 13 times its expected future earnings (based on analyst estimates)  SoundHound's market cap is just around $4 billion (versus $26 billion for Supermicro) The company got a boost from acquisitions, which have diversified its customer base in the process . NextEra Energy owns one of the largest regulated utilities in the United States . The company has increased its dividend at a compound annual rate of 10% over the past decade . AI and data centers could be a very important end market .  NextEra is a conservative and dividend-growth-focused option . Brookfield Renewable is a high-yield choice . NuScale Power is a leading-edge nuclear power investment that will probably excite more aggressive investors . The stock is risky to buy today because of the company's heavy cash burn . AI developers are flocking to its cloud platform to utilize its data centers for training and running AI systems .  CoreWeave had negative free cash flow of $1.35 billion in the first quarter of 2025 . Guidance calls for major growth in the future . In 2025 alone, the company is expecting to spend at least $20 billion on capital expenditures .  Management will likely need to take out more debt and sell more shares of its common stock in order to get the cash needed for these capital expenditures . This will require a lot of capital raising, as the company has well under $5 billion in cash on the balance sheet . The company has loaded up its balance sheet with debt, which has high interest expenses .  CoreWeave will be trading at a price-to-sales ratio (P/S) of 14.2 .
